body: close due to fixed.
close due to unknown repo
close due to #547
If the slave is hanged, the request will take more than 5 seconds. In more cases, master-slave synchronization will be fast, so this problem does not occur.
@YuShanMuGong this PR(https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/pull/561) can resolve your issue, and could you help to review this PR and give us your verification result?

It is recommended to pay attention to whether the disk has a bottleneck or open transientStorePoolEnable config may it to reduce the probability of this exception. and issue only used be bug report and feature request, so, it would be nice if we can discuss these question in our mailing list(https://rocketmq.apache.org/about/contact/).
@bean326 这个是一个非常好的一个涉及，尤其是在顺序消息里面，服务端可以通过设置系统变量rocketmq.broker.rebalance.lockMaxLiveTime这个值来减少锁的时间。另外，issue 只用于bug报告以及新特性提出，希望可以在邮件列表里面讨论问题呀（https://rocketmq.apache.org/about/contact/），很多小伙伴会及时回复的。
@iNanos what's your version of rocketmq, and this restart rocketmq is master or slave? could you provide more information about this issue?
@Liberxue good catch, you can pull a request to add some limit of the topic name.
topic name is too length ?

@reachfish the release  process of pagecache is managed by os, or you can use echo 3 > /proc/sys/vm/drop_caches to release, but not recommend to do this. and issue only used be bug report and feature request, so, it would be nice if we can discuss these question in our mailing list(https://rocketmq.apache.org/about/contact/)
lgtm
Implemented in this [PR](https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/pull/1314)

@wendyxiao DLedger lack the logic to delete the index file by now. Welcome to submit the relevant PR to [OpenMessaging DLedger](https://github.com/openmessaging/openmessaging-storage-dledger/pulls).
No need to implement this feature, flow control on topic  https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ROCKETMQ-106  should solve the problem
Rocketmq provides several strategies now for example Consistent Hashing , please see the class in package `org.apache.rocketmq.client.consumer.rebalance `

No, you can't simply do that. 
If you have to change the version of a dependency, you should change the pom and refactor the related codes, then rebuild the project. However, it is not recommended because it is unsafe and whether the new version is fully compatible is not known.
For the issue of fastjson, we will check it out later and see if we should apply the new version.

@bean326 I'd love to reproduce and explore it, would u please give more info such as how much the time difference is between producer machine and consumer machine? Are there error messages printed when can not be consumed normally?

IMHO, making the number of the queue even is not necessarily effective to the balance or to reduce the duplication because different queues may have different workloads. We need to discuss it thoroughly.
Anyway, it is always welcome to propose a RIP and PR if you have any ideas.

For the PR is to fix the CLI problem, it is necessary to add UT to test Command covering two scenarios: 1. invalid topic length; 2. invalid characters in the topic. You may refer to PR #937 to see how to build a command test.
Please check your code logic, if createOK you should print ok infomation, instead of printing ok in the else block. And please add log when createOK=false. :)
Use {} in log is more efficient than String.format, and if you want to print the full stack you can add a new line ```log.warn("Full stack: ", e)```

In Cassandra, the default JVM MAX heap size=max(min(1/2 ram, 1024MB), min(1/4 ram, 8GB)). Maybe it is better if we also add a threshold value of MAX size, in case the JVM using unnecessary large memory when deploying on a large memory machine. For example, may use nearly 120GB on 512GB machine, but usually, we do not need 120GB JVM, right?
@vongosling  @duhenglucky PTAL.
Please merge to develop branch :)
Diamond types are not supported at jdk1.6

> Diamond types are not supported at jdk1.6

RocketMQ required jdk1.8  in the root pom.xml.

```
        <maven.compiler.source>1.8</maven.compiler.source>
        <maven.compiler.target>1.8</maven.compiler.target>
```

Furthermore, how about declare the type of field `configTable`  as `Map`?

Change 
```
private final HashMap<String/* Namespace */, HashMap<String/* Key */, String/* Value */>> configTable =	    private final HashMap<String/* Namespace */, HashMap<String/* Key */, String/* Value */>> configTable =
        new HashMap<String, HashMap<String, String>>()
```

To 

```
private final Map<String/* Namespace */, HashMap<String/* Key */, String/* Value */>> configTable =
        new HashMap<>();
```
I agree with u ，and you could try to communicate with the community commiter

> Please merge to develop branch :)
